com.atakmap.android.maps

Class Marker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.maps.FilterMetaDataHolder
      • com.atakmap.android.maps.MapItem
        • com.atakmap.android.maps.PointMapItem
          • com.atakmap.android.maps.Marker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    URIContent, HashtagContent, Capturable, Exportable, MetaDataHolder, VisibilityListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicRangeAndBearingEndpoint

    public class Marker
extends PointMapItem
implements Exportable, Capturable
    A geo-space map icon with optional text and style settings

    Marker has the following properties:

  • icon defines the icon image states and pixel that maps to the marker GeoPoint (anchor)
  • title defines the text drawn below, center the icon image
  • state affects the stylized view state or touch event interaction
  • hitBounds defines the pixel area where the Marker may be touched offset from the icon anchor

    • Notable UserControlComponent (touch) behavior:

  • state will be updated for STATE_PRESSED_MASK
  • hitBounds affects hit testing when handling touch events

    • Notable GLMapComponent (graphics) behavior:

  • when state contains STATE_PRESSED_MASK, a highlight is drawn around hitBounts
  • title text will always be drawn centered on the current icon

    • FAIR WARNING - DO NOT EXTEND ME

      • STYLE_ROTATE_HEADING_MASK

        public static final int STYLE_ROTATE_HEADING_MASK
        Indicates the icon should be rotated according to the track heading. The icon is assumed to be naturally at heading 0 degrees and will be rotated counter clockwise from there. This is a handy feature for implementing markers that are rotating arrows.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STYLE_ROTATE_HEADING_NOARROW_MASK

        public static final int STYLE_ROTATE_HEADING_NOARROW_MASK
        If Rotating arrows are not desired and full rotation is desired, set the following flag.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Parameters:

      • setTextRenderFlag

        public void setTextRenderFlag(int flag)
        Set the text rendering underneath the marker. If set to default the text will render when the min zoom level is reached which is the original behavior. If set to ALWAYS_SHOW, then the text will always show, if set to NEVER_SHOW, the text will never render.

      • getTextRenderFlag

      • getAffiliationColor

        public static int getAffiliationColor(Marker t)
        Given a marker, this will search throug all of the know locations to find out the markers affiliation For example, red = hostile, blue = friendly, gold team = yello.

      • getAffiliationColor

        public static int getAffiliationColor(java.lang.String type)
        Uses the type to determine the affiliation color: red = hostile, blue = friendly for example.
